title: What advice can you give to someone about halfway through writing their first fiction novel? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ll be honest: you aren’t halfway through it. You are halfway through your first draft, and you will need a lot of work yet before it’s ready. Get comfortable with that now. It will save you a lot of heartache. You SHOULD be proud of what you’ve done: you’ve taken amazing strides to realize your dream! But it’s so important to pace yourself and learn that it’s a process … not a destination. Now go write the other half! Then put it away for at least a couple of weeks, preferably a month, and read it cold. See it for what it is, clearly, and how you can make it better. Then rewrite, and put it in front of others. While they’re reading it, start something new. Always forward motion.

Quality is best. When you get halfway, one of the things that begin to stop you is the need to finish, the desire to finish, but it snufs out the flame to quality. Don’t rush it, because once you do, it’s not a matter of delete and retype. It’s a matter of ctrl+a delete and rewrite.
